benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Trigger a payment (authorization, purchase or credit)

covered: POST Method: Valid Payload scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC17, TC18, TC24, TC25, TC26)
POST Method: Invalid payload / malformed request (TC09)
POST Method: Validation / input constraints (TC07, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC16, TC19)
POST Method: Unknown/declined/aborted gateway or plugin behavior (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC13, TC23)
POST Method: Dependency degradation / gateway availability (TC12, TC13, TC23)
Post-creation response content validation (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC24)
gaps: Caching behavior / HTTP caching headers validation (ETag, Cache-Control) is not tested
Explicit rate-limiting / throttling tests are not defined (only concurrent requests are implied in TC22)
Duplicate submission handling is not explicitly isolated from normal flow (while TC22 touches concurrency, explicit deduping scenarios are not isolated)
Pagination is not applicable to a single resource POST, but guidelines mention pagination for GET; no GET coverage here (not required by story)
recommendations: Add explicit tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on POST responses where applicable.
Add explicit rate-limiting/throttling tests to validate behavior under bursts.
Add a dedicated duplicate-submission scenario to ensure idempotency or dedup logic is enforced.
If applicable, maintain coverage of any edge-cases around feature flags or plugin resolution order with clarity in tests.
Review TC25 for more concrete backward-compatibility expectations across API versions.
